intro: Cousinia anoplophylla, commonly known as the smoothleaf cushionflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the tribe Cardueae within the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often woolly foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, forming dense cushions that help it conserve water in harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, bract-like leaves that are densely packed. Cousinia anoplophylla is adapted to survive in extreme conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
